node.display_long_description:
CLOSE COMBAT: THE MOST REVOLUTIONARY VERSION SINCE THE GAME’S RELEASE.

The Horizon scientific research laboratory is a deceptively quiet place. When you came round, there were hundreds of the living dead all around you. All because of that damn T12 virus.

To survive and save the world from the virus, use both hands and your head: never stop shooting, pick up rounds, climb up pipes and ladders, jump onto bars and grab hold of ropes, search cupboards and throw everything you find at the zombies.

You’re free to choose whatever weapons and tactics you want. Prove your agility, imagination and accuracy.

The denizens of the Horizon station will punish you for one thing: hesitation...

* FEATURES *

●  Realistic bloody graphics in the spirit of zombie apocalypse films.
●  Use two controllers actively: fire with both hands, fire as you hang on a rope, reload your shotgun with your second hand, grab onto pipes and explore hard-to-reach areas of the station.

latest_supported_binary.change_log:
Thank you so much for your reviews and support!

The Improvements & Bug Fixes Update (Version 0.9.25.6):

- added one-handed bat, available even in the early stages of the game
- increased possible damage caused by the melee weapon
- added a possibility of smashing the heads of zombie corpses
- added death zones for zombies thrown out of the game geometry (e.g., into a pit)
- revised the amount of ammo at each the game levels

Bug Fixes

- dogs attack players in co-op mode again
- decreased the frequency of zombie teleportation at the moment of animation change (e.g., when getting up from the floor)
- decreased the number cases when the beating of a zombie using the melee weapon is unscored (e.g., a blow to the head) by improving the physics calculation
- removed the weapon name text that was shown at the moment the weapon was taken from the holster
- removed the incorrect behavior of a weapon that sometimes occurred when frequently moving it from one hand to another
- removed the eventual falling of the vest caused by the geometry in the tutorial
- brought back the sounds of Ogryn laughing (when he is being hit)
- improved the game performance

If you have any ideas regarding game improvement or if you are facing any bugs, please write us at info@dream-dev.com. 

----
Version 0.9.25.5

CLOSE COMBAT: THE MOST REVOLUTIONARY VERSION SINCE THE GAME’S RELEASE.

The brand-new Close Combat version features new and improved weapons, greater combat versatility, and improved visuals. 

Upgrades include:

- We’ve added 15+ melee weapons – pipes, bats, hammers, rebar, and more.
- Melee weapons are divided into categories and differentiated not only visually, but also by weight, ease of use, damage, and other factors.
- Hold the weapon where you like and how you like. Prefer a one-handed grip? Two-handed? It’s up to you! And remember – this affects your strike power and accuracy, too.
- Player interactions with enemies have been completely redesigned. The enemy now reacts not only to being shot, but also to melee weapon interactions, weapon stock interactions, and even bare-handed interactions.
- You can knock down enemies and then beat them to death.
- Enemy reaction physics have changed: all interactions with enemies now look more realistic.
- Gameplay has been completely rebalanced. You wanted more headshots; we delivered.
- We introduce a modified and improved enemy type – the Mask.
- A new attack type has been added: bite.
- Game sounds have been modified and improved.
- Visual elements associated with enemies have been improved.

nodes.title: Happy Howl-o-ween!
nodes.body_text:
The rooms and corridors of the Horizon Laboratory have changed –pumpkins and other suspicious objects have been discovered.

Your mission is to investigate it all, so that it can return to normal!

node.reviewDescription:
I have been playing this for a week and really enjoying it. It's extremely simple in execution, and yet keeps me on my toes, spinning around in my living room watching behind me (when I can!).

Yesterday I died on the last level, so I shut down and came back today to finish it. As soon as it loaded I noticed a baseball bat in a locker. Hmmm... Never seen one before. The there was a wrench, and a pipe, and rebar I think... Anyways. I do love how you can put a melee weapon on your back. Really like that. I'll echo another comment I saw here - the baseball bat feels like a pool noodle. Whereas the wrench felt solid for me.

I ended up just not using any melee weapons at all since they aren't as fast as killing zombies most of the time. Except for once I knocked a zombies head straight off with one hit and that was great!

I do want to mention crawling through the vents. I love that - but the issue I have is it's near impossible to draw a gun out of a holster when doing that - if you spot a zombie down in a room - it's too hard to draw a gun to take him out stealth like. My guns are rattling around below the surface of the vent. I had to stand on my tippy toes to finally get it to work. Not sure if that can be tweaked somehow.

My only other issue is if I have 2 handguns, a keycard, and a rifle - then I pick up a shotgun and use that in my hands - when I reload it - it drops my rifle and I lose that. I usually like to pick up the shotgun, use it for what ammo I have then I just want to throw it away and pull off my rifle. 

However - all that nitpicking aside - this - is 'the' game I had imagined when I bought my Quest. It's simple, the graphics work well. I don't quite get the story - if there is one lol - but it's given me some good jump scares. For the $ - it's easily a MUST BUY.

Thanks to the devs for continuing to support it. Will be recommending to others and trying Co-op soon!

developerResponse.body:
Hey AlexanderMcG,

Thank you for your in-depth review. 

We’re glad that you liked our game. 

By the way, the new major updates are in the works now; they will have Horde Mode and the New Chapter.
